Pre-Game Insights: Andy Robertson said: 'We know that's what's at stake. We have to be at our best and if we can do that, who knows where we'll be come 23 June.'

Steve Clarke said: 'I think we should all be proud that we're here. It's been a long time since 1998 when we actually travelled abroad to appear in a tournament like this. We're proud we've been able to do back-to-back tournaments and hopefully by the end of this we'll be even more proud at having done something a bit more special.'

Scott McKenna said: 'It's a great opportunity for them to come and experience a tournament on foreign soil for the first time in a long time. I think the Tartan Army will be very excited, they're travelling in their numbers and I hope we can put in a performance they can be proud of and celebrate as well.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: Scotland fans have been going all out for the team ahead of Friday's game, with many wearing kilts and an estimated 200,000 fans expected to head over during the next few weeks of the competition.
The Scotland team had their last training session on Thursday morning before heading to Munich.
